intro: The International Summer School on Software Engineering (ISSSE 2013) aims at providing a forum to let Master and fresh Ph.D. students get in touch with top Software Engineering scholars and the research they pursue. The school typically attracts around 30-40 Ph.D. students from all around the world.

lectures.name: Muhammad Ali
lectures.title: Cloud Computing for Global Software Engineering: Designing Infrastructures and Supporting Migration

lectures.name: Andrea De Lucia
lectures.affiliation: University of Salerno and University of Sannio, Italy
lectures.title: Refactoring Software Systems: Challenges, Solutions, and Open Issues

lectures.title: Practical Mining of Unstructured Sources to Support Software Engineers

lectures.name: Paloma
lectures.affiliation: Universidad Carlos III de Madrid, Spain
lectures.title: Integrating Design Patterns in the Web Development Life Cycle

lectures.name: Schahram Dustdar
lectures.title: Elastic Computing - Principles, Models, and Algorithms for Software Services, Things, and People on the Cloud

lectures.name: Helen
lectures.title: Social and Human Aspects of Software Engineering
